GenesisBlockHashAlgorithm.condition: Conditionally required for non provisional records
GenesisBlockHashAlgorithm.title: Genesis Block Hash Algorithm
GenesisBlockHashAlgorithm.description: Block hash algorithm used to produce the block hash of the genesis block

enum_elaboration.BLAKE2 (Base58): The hash algorithm is based on BLAKE with 256 bit digest, encoded to Base 58.
enum_elaboration.BLAKE-256: The hash algorithm is based on BLAKE with 256 bit digest
enum_elaboration.BLAKE2b-256: The hash algorithm is based on BLAKE2b with 256 bit digest
enum_elaboration.BLAKE2b-256 (0x): The hash algorithm is based on BLAKE2b with 256 bit digest. Prepended with a leading 0x.
enum_elaboration.BLAKE2s-256: The hash algorithm is based on BLAKE2s with 256 bit digest
enum_elaboration.Double SHA-256: The hash algorithm is based on SHA-2 256 bit and computes: SHA-256(SHA-256(value))
enum_elaboration.Keccak-256: The hash algorithm is based on Keccak SHA-3 submission (2011) which is availalbe in: https://keccak.team/files/Keccak-submission-3.pdf
enum_elaboration.LISK SPEC: Bespoke Lisk function: the data of the header of a signed block is put into a data block in a specified way. Afterwards, the data block is used as the input message for SHA-256. The first 8 bytes of the output are reversed and used as the blockID.
enum_elaboration.LOST: The hash algorithm has been lost
enum_elaboration.Poseidon Hash: Poseidon Hash function as defined here: https://www.poseidon-hash.info/
enum_elaboration.SHAKE-256: The hash algorithm is based on SHAKE (SHA-3 variant) with 256 bit digest
enum_elaboration.SHA-224 (160Bits): The hash algorithm is based on SHA-2 224 bit, stored as 160 bits
enum_elaboration.SHA3-256: The hash algorithm is based on SHA-3 256 bit and computes: SHA-256(value)
enum_elaboration.SHA3-256 (Base58): The hash algorithm is based on SHA-3 256 bit, encoded to Base 58.
enum_elaboration.SHA-256 (Decimals): The hash algorithm is based on SHAKE (SHA-3 variant) with 256 bit digest. The output is converted to decimals.
enum_elaboration.SHA-256: The hash algorithm is based on SHA-2 256 bit and computes: SHA-256(value)
enum_elaboration.SHA-256 (Base32): The hash algorithm is based on SHA-2 256 bit, encoded to Base 32.
enum_elaboration.SHA-256 (Base58): The hash algorithm is based on SHA-2 256 bit, encoded to Base 58.
enum_elaboration.SHA-256 (Base64url): The hash algorithm is based on SHA-2 256 bit, encoded to Base 64url.
enum_elaboration.SHA-384: The hash algorithm is based on SHA-2 256 bit with 384 bit digest
enum_elaboration.SHA-512Half: Calculates a SHA-512 hash, then takes the first half of the output. (That's 256 bits, which is 32 bytes, or 64 characters of the hexadecimal representation.)
enum_elaboration.SHA512/256 (Base32): The hash algorithm is based on SHA-2 512 bit with 512 bit digest, output is truncated to 256 bits.
enum_elaboration.SteemHash: SHA224, truncated to 160 bytes, first 4 bytes replaced with the block height + 1 (where this number is expressed in big-endian format).
enum_elaboration.VRF Signature: Block signature generated by a Verifiable Random Function

Provisional.title: Provisional Digital Token Identifier
Provisional.description: If true, the record contains normative or informative data elements in a provisional request for a DTI when one or more data elements (which may include mandatory data elements) are not yet available

Private.title: Private Digital Token
Private.description: If true, the record contains normative or informative data elements that are verified according to the DTIF guidelines but may not be independently verifiable by the general public

Disputed.title: Disputed Digital Token Identifier
Disputed.description: If true, the record contains normative or informative data elements that are disputed by one or more DTIF users

Deleted.title: Deleted Digital Token Identifier
Deleted.description: Record is marked Deleted due to technical reason(s) (e.g. invalid or duplicate token) or due to business reason(s) (e.g. a provisional token becomes invalid). Users are advised not to use this token.
